intro: Piaranthus parvulus, commonly known as the dwarf star-of-Bethlehem, is a small, flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces white or pale blue flowers that bloom in the spring, often in clusters at the base of the plant. It is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
